Description: Rim sherd of Attic pottery floral band-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: lip glazed; in handle zone, addorsed ivy and berries no doubt to either side of central red line; inscription on lip.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "A" was added by the British Museum Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from other 1912.40 sherds. There is no evidence of black figure related incision on the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 414, no. B637) (labelled 1912.40)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0522) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
